armourer.desc: Here you can craft armor, repair damaged equipment, dismantle equipment for parts or remove upgrades from sockets.

banditcamp.label: Bandit Camp
banditcamp.desc: A group of dangerous bandits have made camp here.

barber.label: Barber
barber.desc: Visit barbers for a shave or a new haircut.

blacksmith.desc: Here you can craft weapons, repair damaged equipment, dismantle equipment for parts or remove upgrades from sockets.

desc.player: Gamble your hard earned coin playing Gwent here.

desc.foodDrinkAndGwent: Sells Gwent cards, food, and drink

misc.liberated: This merchant appears after liberating the area.

desc.ursineSteelSword: In a chest in the basement of this ruin
desc.enhancedUrsineBoots: In an unmarked cave in the mountainside
desc.superiorGriffinSilverSword: Located in the cave system below
desc.jarlMadmanLugos: You get the Card 'Vampire: Katakan' from him (Gwent Quest: Skellige) (all cards here
desc.mastercraftedFelineArmor: Mastercrafted Feline Armor, Gautlets, Trousers and Boots

desc.kingsGambit: 'King's Gambit Quest'. Draw from a Place of Power to gain a temporary bonus. The first time you draw from any Place of Power, you also receive 1 Ability Point
desc.sunstone: 'The Sunstone' quest. Draw from a Place of Power to gain a temporary bonus. The first time you draw from any Place of Power, you also receive 1 Ability Point

desc.mapsCraftingSuppliesFoodAndDrink: Sells maps, crafting supplies, food, and drink
desc.mapsCraftingSuppliesFishAndSaddles: Sells maps, crafting supplies, fish and 'Mastercrafted Cavalry Saddle' (+75)

desc.trottheim: This village was once famed across all of Skellige for the fact that it was inhabited exclusively by women, all their men having died during one raid or another
desc.harviken: Home seat to Clan Dimun, and the location where Holger Blackhand divvies out the loot after every successful raid
desc.larvik: The largest village on Hindarsfjall and home seat to Donar, head of Clan an Hindar. Its inhabitants are just and god-fearing folk, traditionalists strident in their devotion to Freya
desc.freyasGarden: Garden dedicated to the goddess Freya. Once beautiful and filled with thousands of fragrant blooms and herbs, today it lies abandoned and untended
desc.lofoten: Once a rich and vibrant village, today Lofoten is a ravaged and crumbling ruin
desc.lofotenCemetery: The inhabitants of Lofoten often visit this small cemetery to care for the graves of their loved ones and ask Freya for blessings in the afterlife
desc.isolatedHut: They say this was once home to a herbalist who came to the isles from the continent. Unable to find a place in any of the nearby villages, she settled in this seaside hut, where she recieved the occasional visitor in need of magic creams of bandages
desc.lurthen: Lurthen's most famous inhabitant was a certain Peter Pijus, known for the fact that he was able to drink an entire barrel of mead in one go and remain standing
desc.trailToYngvarsFang: This is the start of the mountain trail leading to Yngvar's Fang, the pride and glory of An Skellig
desc.yngvarsFang: This mountain peak was named after the mythical bear which, according to legend, was defeated by Tyr, the heroic founder of Clan Tuirsearch
desc.uriallaHarbor: On account of their mastery of their craft and painstaking attention to detail, the shipwrights working in this harbor are considered the best in the isles
desc.bayOfWinds: Three generations ago this bay was a popular meeting spot for the local youth. Then one night a terrible storm broke out and the sea pounded into the beach, swallowing up several merry-makers and dragging them out to a watery grave
desc.hov: Village known throughout all of Skellige for the infamous arena which once hosted fierce fights between the mightiest warriors in the isles
desc.svorlag: The village was founded by the mythical Sove, who killed a terrifying and bloodthirsty chimera on this spot
desc.oldWatchtower: The ruins of an old watchtower in which, according to legend, a crazed Koviri princess once locked herself up, convinced only a man able to free her from this tower would be fit to be her husband. No one even tried, however, the princess died of old age and the tower fell into disrepair with the passage of time
desc.thePaliGapCoast: Elders say an isolated cave on this coast was once used as a retreat by the world's most famous bard (before the rise of Dandelion, that is): the great Xirdneh of Zanguebar, renowned from Nazair to the Dragon Mountains for his ferocious lute-strumming
desc.kaerAlmhult: Built centuries ago to serve as the home keep for the kings of Skellige. In practice, however, each ruler preferred to keep to his clan's seat, and Kaer Almhult was left unused. Eventually the decision was made to turn it into a prison, and today the fortress is a crumbling ruin
desc.marlinCoast: Until quite recently this beach was frequented by fishermen come to fish marlins out of the nearby waters
desc.gullPoint: Sea fowl come from miles around to congregate on this scrap of barren land, mate and lay eggs
desc.dorveRuins: Ruins of a village destroyed by the Ice Giant
desc.clanTordarrochForge: A famous forge where the best tools and weapons in all of Skellige were once made. When the Ice Giant took over the isle, he turned it into his larder
desc.urskar: The villagers here were famous for their love of pickled herring. They ate it for breakfast, dinner, and supper, and even made jams and compotes out of it
desc.abandonedVillage: This village's residents were forced to abandon it in a hurry when the Ice Giant unexpectedly awoke and decided to make known his wrath
desc.torGvalchca: An ancient tower which was erected in the days when elves were the unchallenged masters of these lands
desc.elverumLighthouse: The former keeper of this lighthouse was a confirmed eccentric. In addition to caring for the lighthouse, he also wrote poetry and wove carpets, was known to strip naked and run laps around the lighthouse at noon while shouting "sound mind in a sound body" and for breakfast would eat nothing but fish tails
desc.ruinedInn: Ruined and burned-down tavern which once treated locals and travelers to the best roast lamb around
desc.fyresdal: Those living here are tough on the outside, but soft and tender within
desc.kaerMuire: This fortress has served as Clan Drummond's home base for centuries. the days when it was new and in full repair are a distant memory now
desc.holmsteinsPort: Piers and docks for the village of Holmstein - Clan Drummond's chief port
desc.wildShore: A wild and untamed™ part of the isle's coastline. A favourite spot for bandits and lovers
desc.distillery: A shroud of secrecy envelops this place. All that is known is that it produces the finest hooch in all of skellige
desc.grotto: An isolated-off locale that can only be reached by boat
desc.palisade: The remnants of the palisade that once marked the border between the territories of Clan Drummond and Clan an Craite
desc.arinbjorn: A village whose calm is only occasionally disturbed by someone slapping another senseless or one comrade breaking a bottle of mead over his mate's head
desc.sund: Small village whose inhabitant are for the most part shepherds
desc.fayrlund: This small village has gained great renown as home to the best hunters in Skellige
desc.boxholm: Boxholm was once a thriving village serving the nearby fortress, Kaer Nyssen. Today nothing remains of this past glory but a pile of stones, some debris, and fading memories
desc.rannvaig: Fifteen years ago, one of the fishermen of Rannvaig bagged an enormous halibut, and from that moment on all the other villagers have devoted their lives to beating his record
desc.blandare: Unusually for a Skellige village, Blandare is located inland, far from any shore. Its inhabitants scratch out a living through mining and shepherding
desc.druidsCamp: Camp pitched by druids investigating the magic cataclysm which devastated the nearby woods
desc.redgill: This village's inhabitants fled in a panic when a mysterious magic cataclysm struck the surrounding area
desc.abandonedSawmill: Though located depp in the forest, an ideal place for lumber harvesting, the sawmill now lies abandoned and unused
desc.gedyneith: An oak which is sacred to all Skelligers, as it is worshiped both by druids and Freya's disciples. The Isle's most important ceremonies are held here, including weddings and royal coronations
desc.gedyneith2: An oak which is sacred to all Skelligers, as it is worshiped both by druids and Freya's disciples. The Isle's most important ceremonies are held here, including weddings and royal coronations
desc.whaleGraveyard: The isle's inhabitants come here and gather bones which they use to build their huts
desc.crossroads: Fork in the road leading to Kaer Trolde
desc.minersCamp: Small camp which local miners use as a base during their gold prospecting expeditions into the mountains to the north
desc.eldbergLighthouse: Lighthouse built on orders of Jarl Skjordal in order to light the sea and route to Arinbjorn
desc.kaerGelen: This old fort's ruins attract the sort whom one would not want to run into in a dark alley
desc.KaerTroldeHarbor: One of the busiest ports in Skellige. Goods from every corner of the world are brought here to be sold and traded
desc.bridgeToKaerTrolde: This stone bridge was, according to legend, carved single-handedly by Grymmdjarr, the heroic founder of Clan an Craite
desc.rogne: This mountain settlement is home to tough folk of indomitable spirit
desc.yustiannasGrotto: Yustianna was a pirate born of a Skelliger from Clan an Craite and a captive woman taken during a raid. In her time she was feared on the Continent from Ofir to Zanguebar. Known for her skill as a navigator and unmatched master of various weapons, she quickly became the terror of the Great Sea, and when she returned to Skellige, they say this cave is where she hid her loot
desc.giantsToes: In truth simply a normal rock formation shaped by centuries of wind and water, islanders believe Uroboros punished giants who opposed his will by turning them into these stones
desc.ancientCrypt: Though Skelligers are famed for bravery bordering on madness, there are certain places which even they keep their distance from. This is one of them
